bwwExcerpt: ...Dames At Sea may lay claim to being one of the silliest, sweetest, most ridiculous musicals of all time. It makes no real pretence at plot or character, preferring to stay firmly in the world of parody, emphasising great, catchy tunes, swell dance routines, risqué jokes, and gooey love affairs between showgirls and randy sailors which would make Roger de Bris call for a wrist massage. And it's terrific with a capital T...Skinner ensures, with impeccable timing, and just the right level of che
